titles.title: A bill to take certain Federal land located in Tuolumne County, California, into trust for the benefit of the Tuolumne Band of Me-Wuk Indians, and for other purposes.
A bill to take certain Federal land located in Tuolumne County, California, into trust for the benefit of the Tuolumne Band of Me-Wuk Indians, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs.
Committee on Indian Affairs. Hearings held. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 114-260.

calendar.text: Committee on Indian Affairs. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Indian Affairs. Reported by Senator Barrasso with an amendment. With written report No. 114-203.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 347.

bill.summary: (Sec. 1) All U.S. interests in approximately 80 acres of specified U.S. Forest Service land located in Tuolumne County, California, must be held in trust for the benefit of the Tuolumne Band of Me-Wuk Indians. Gaming is not permitted on this land.
